eds.evaluate module¶

eds.evaluate.evaluate_regressor(y_actual: numpy.array, y_pred: numpy.array) → dict¶

Evaluates a regression model’s set of predictions. Prints out several performance scores. Returns dictionary containing performance information.

y_actualnp.array

True labels of feature vectors.

y_prednp.array

Predicted labels of feature vectors.

dict

Performance information for each main metric.

eds.evaluate.get_best_regressor(x: numpy.array, y: numpy.array, loss=True, folds=5, metric: Callable[[numpy.array, numpy.array], float] = <function mse>)¶

Tries a suite of different regressors and returns the best performing one.

xnp.array

Set of feature vectors.

ynp.array

Respective outputs of feature vectors.

lossbool, optional, by default True

Whether the metric is a loss function. (Smaller means better)

foldsint, optional, by default 5

Number of folds for cross-validation

metricCallable[[np.array, np.array], float], optional, by default metrics.mse

Custom metric to minimize, by default mean squared error.

model

Sklearn like model that performed best compared to a wide selection of models.

eds.evaluate.get_cross_val_ci(model, x: numpy.array, y: numpy.array, loss=True, metric: Callable[[numpy.array, numpy.array], float] = None, folds=5) → dict¶

Returns performance evaluation of a model based on default or custom metric. Constructs a 95% confidence interval for an estimation of performance.

model

Model to evaluate cross-validation performance on.

xnp.array

Set of feature vectors.

ynp.array

Respective outputs of feature vectors.

loss: bool, default True

Whether this is a loss function (should be minimized) or opposite.

metricCallable[[np.array, np.array], float]

Custom metric to use for evaluating cross-validation performance.

folds: int

Number of cross-validation folds.

np.array

Dictionary containing performance information.

eds.evaluate.try_many_regressors(x: numpy.array, y: numpy.array, loss=True, folds=5, metric: Callable[[numpy.array, numpy.array], float] = <function mse>) → dict¶

Tries a set of different regression models and returns report on the model’s performances.

xnp.array

Set of feature vectors.

ynp.array

Respective outputs of feature vectors.

lossbool, optional, by default True

Whether the metric is a loss function. (Smaller means better)

foldsint, optional, by default 5

Number of folds for cross-validation

metricCallable[[np.array, np.array], float], optional, by default metrics.mse

Custom metric to minimize, by default mean squared error.

dict

Dictionary containing result information including a confidence interval of the model’s score as well as the unfitted model.
